title: Observed Antibody Space: A diverse database of cleaned, annotated, and translated unpaired and paired antibody sequences
abstract: The Observed Antibody Space (OAS) database was created to offer clean, annotated, and translated repertoire data for antibody research. This resource provides a comprehensive collection of antibody sequences that serves as a foundation for training language models like AbLang.

title: A machine learning strategy for the identification of key in silico descriptors and prediction models for IgG monoclonal antibody developability properties
abstract: This study presents a machine learning approach to identify key computational descriptors and develop prediction models for IgG monoclonal antibody developability properties, including aggregation, viscosity, and stability metrics.

title: Machine learning prediction of antibody aggregation and viscosity for high concentration formulation development of protein therapeutics
abstract: Development of machine learning models to predict antibody aggregation and viscosity, critical parameters for high-concentration formulations of therapeutic antibodies. These properties are key developability metrics that impact manufacturability and stability.

title: The need to consider an antibody's 'developability' in therapeutic antibody design
abstract: Comprehensive review of antibody developability considerations including immunogenicity, solubility, specificity, stability, manufacturability, and storability. Predicting these properties rapidly and inexpensively is critical to industrial workflows.
